str2: Of little faith. From oligos and pistis; incredulous, i.e. Lacking confidence.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Cowardly, timid, fearful. From deos; timid, i.e. faithless.
Then, at that time. From ho and hote; the when, i.e. At the time that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A calm. Of uncertain derivation; tranquillity.
